children.name: Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy
Effective date: February 02, 2021

TaskCall Inc. places great importance on protecting your privacy and takes its responsibilities in this regard very seriously. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, utilize and disclose your personally identifiable information, also known as personal data or PII, when you use our Software-as-a-Service Information Technology on-call schedule management, alerting, and incident tracking Services, participate in our events or use our Websites or mobile applications that link to this policy. In this Privacy Policy, our Websites, Services, Events, and Apps are collectively referred to as our "Online Services."

We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions.
Consent
Consent

By using our Online Services, you are indicating that you agree to the terms and conditions set forth in this Privacy Policy and are expressly consenting to the processing of your data in accordance with this policy. If you do not agree with any of the terms and conditions, or do not approve of TaskCall's data practices as described herein, then you should immediately stop using our Online Services. To the maximum extent permitted by the applicable law, any disputes regarding privacy or the terms contained in this Privacy Policy and Terms of Use, or any other agreement between us and you, will be subject to the laws of the state of Delaware, USA.
Types of Data Collected
Types of Data Collected
Information provided by website visitors
Information provided by website visitors

If you choose to sign up for information from TaskCall, schedule a demo, attend a virtual event, or create an account to use the Service, we may collect certain personally identifiable information (PII) from you, including your first and last name, organization name, job title, email address, phone number, location information (such as state/province and country). If you contact us via email, we will collect your name and email address, as well as any other content or information included in or attached to your email, in order to respond to you. If you purchase services or products from us, we will also collect payment account and other financial information.

We may also combine the information we collect directly from you with information obtained from public sources, partners, and other third parties and use such combined information in accordance with this Privacy Policy.
Information collected by technological means
Information collected by technological means

Our servers, which may be hosted by a third-party service provider, collect technical data about your device and software when you use our Online Services. This data includes information about your browser type, operating system, IP address (a unique number assigned to your device when you connect to the Internet), domain name, and a time stamp of your visit. We automatically collect and store this data in log files each time you access our website or your account on our network. However, unless you have provided us with your personally identifiable information (PII), this technical data cannot be used to identify you. Additionally, we may collect analytics data directly or through third-party tools to help us understand traffic and usage trends of our Online Services. We collect and use this analytics data in an aggregate form, which means it cannot be used to identify any specific user.
Information collected from mobile devices
Information collected from mobile devices

As you download and use our Apps, we collect information about the type of mobile device you're using and its operating system version. While downloading or using the Apps, we don't request, access, or track your specific location information from your mobile device. However, we may infer your general geographic location based on your IP address. Our Apps may send push notifications, which you can disable at the device level if you no longer wish to receive them.
Cookies and other tracking technologies
Cookies and other tracking technologies

We utilize various technical tools, such as cookies, web beacons, and similar tracking technologies, to track the activities of our users on our Online Services. Cookies are small pieces of data sent by a website to your computer's hard drive when you browse a website, while web beacons refer to tracking technologies used to verify if you have accessed specific content on our Online Services. We use or may use cookies for the following purposes:

• Performance cookies: These cookies help us count visits and traffic sources, allowing us to measure and improve the performance of our site. They provide insight into the most and least popular pages on our site and show us how users navigate through the site. The information collected by these cookies is anonymous and cannot be used to identify individual users.
Performance cookies:

These cookies help us count visits and traffic sources, allowing us to measure and improve the performance of our site. They provide insight into the most and least popular pages on our site and show us how users navigate through the site. The information collected by these cookies is anonymous and cannot be used to identify individual users.

• Targeting cookies: These cookies are set by our advertising partners through our site. They may use your browsing history to create a profile of your interests and display relevant advertisements on other websites. These cookies uniquely identify your browser and device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will not receive targeted advertising across different websites.
Targeting cookies:

These cookies are set by our advertising partners through our site. They may use your browsing history to create a profile of your interests and display relevant advertisements on other websites. These cookies uniquely identify your browser and device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will not receive targeted advertising across different websites.

• Functional cookies: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as videos and live chats. We may set these cookies, or they may be set by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies, some or all of these features may not work correctly.
Functional cookies:

These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as videos and live chats. We may set these cookies, or they may be set by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies, some or all of these features may not work correctly.

• Strictly necessary cookies: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be turned off in our systems. They are usually set in response to actions taken by you, such as setting privacy preferences, logging in, or filling out forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site may not work correctly as a result. You can update your Cookie preferences anytime on our website. We may link the information we gather from cookies or other technologies to the personally identifiable information you provide while using our Online Services. We use both session cookies (which expire when you close your browser) and persistent cookies (which ¬¬remain on your computer until you delete them) to provide you with a personalized and interactive experience on our Online Services. You can remove persistent cookies at any time by following the directions in the “Help” section of your Internet browser. Please note that if you choose to disable cookies, some features of our Online Services may not work correctly. Our partners, affiliates, and service providers may also use cookies and other technologies to enhance your experience while interacting with our Online Services, and to deliver or target advertising. We may receive individual and aggregated reports based on the use of certain technologies by these companies.
Strictly necessary cookies:

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be turned off in our systems. They are usually set in response to actions taken by you, such as setting privacy preferences, logging in, or filling out forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site may not work correctly as a result. You can update your Cookie preferences anytime on our website. We may link the information we gather from cookies or other technologies to the personally identifiable information you provide while using our Online Services. You can remove persistent cookies at any time by following the directions in the “Help” section of your Internet browser. Please note that if you choose to disable cookies, some features of our Online Services may not work correctly. Our partners, affiliates, and service providers may also use cookies and other technologies to enhance your experience while interacting with our Online Services, and to deliver or target advertising. We may receive individual and aggregated reports based on the use of certain technologies by these companies.
Usage of Data Collected
Usage of Data Collected

We use your Personally Identifiable Information (PII) for various purposes such as responding to your requests, securing and enhancing our Online Services, and complying with legal obligations. TaskCall uses your PII for the following purposes as necessary and permitted by applicable law:
• Creating and securing your account on our Online Services
Creating and securing your account on our Online Services
• Identifying you as a user of our Online Services
Identifying you as a user of our Online Services
• Providing and administering your use of the Online Services
Providing and administering your use of the Online Services
• Personalizing and improving the quality of your experience on our Online Services
Personalizing and improving the quality of your experience on our Online Services
• Verifying ownership of the email address provided during account creation
Verifying ownership of the email address provided during account creation
• Sending you administrative email notifications related to security, support, and maintenance
Sending you administrative email notifications related to security, support, and maintenance
• Responding to your inquiries and requests
Responding to your inquiries and requests
• Providing you with newsletters or surveys, either electronically or in hardcopy
Providing you with newsletters or surveys, either electronically or in hardcopy
• Determining which of our products and services may be of interest to you or your business
Determining which of our products and services may be of interest to you or your business
• Sending you information about upgrades and special offers related to our Online Services
Sending you information about upgrades and special offers related to our Online Services
• Complying with applicable laws and regulations
Complying with applicable laws and regulations
• Responding to lawful requests, court orders, and legal processes
Responding to lawful requests, court orders, and legal processes
• Protecting our legal interests or those with whom we do business
Protecting our legal interests or those with whom we do business
We may also generate reports with aggregate data about the usage of our Online Services, which cannot reasonably identify any individual and do not contain PII.
Disclosure Of Data
Disclosure Of Data
TaskCall may disclose your PII in certain situations as follows:

• Service providers: We may engage third-party companies or individuals, including our affiliates, to assist us with the purposes listed above, such as to provide IT services, process payments, or contact users in case of an alert.
Service providers:

We may engage third-party companies or individuals, including our affiliates, to assist us with the purposes listed above, such as to provide IT services, process payments, or contact users in case of an alert.

• Law enforcement: We may be required to disclose your PII by law, legal process, litigation, or requests from public and governmental authorities, within or outside your country of residence. We may also disclose your PII if we determine it is necessary to enforce our terms and conditions or protect our operations or users.
Law enforcement:

We may be required to disclose your PII by law, legal process, litigation, or requests from public and governmental authorities, within or outside your country of residence. We may also disclose your PII if we determine it is necessary to enforce our terms and conditions or protect our operations or users.

• Business transfer: We may share your PII in the event of a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, dissolution, reorganization, sale of some or all of TaskCall's assets, financing acquisition of all or a portion of our business, a similar transaction or proceeding, or steps in contemplation of such activities (e.g. due diligence). We may also disclose your PII with your prior informed consent. Service providers acting on our behalf are required to adhere to confidentiality requirements no less protective than those outlined in this policy and will only receive access to your PII as necessary to perform their functions. We may transfer PII, including personal data about residents of the EEA and Switzerland, to our vendors, consultants, and other service providers who require access to such PII to perform work on our behalf. TaskCall will be responsible for the processing of such PII by a third-party service provider unless we can demonstrate that we are not responsible for the event that gave rise to the damages. We may also be required to disclose such PII in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including to meet national security or law enforcement requirements.
Business transfer:

We may share your PII in the event of a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, dissolution, reorganization, sale of some or all of TaskCall's assets, financing acquisition of all or a portion of our business, a similar transaction or proceeding, or steps in contemplation of such activities (e.g. due diligence). We may also disclose your PII with your prior informed consent. Service providers acting on our behalf are required to adhere to confidentiality requirements no less protective than those outlined in this policy and will only receive access to your PII as necessary to perform their functions. We may transfer PII, including personal data about residents of the EEA and Switzerland, to our vendors, consultants, and other service providers who require access to such PII to perform work on our behalf. TaskCall will be responsible for the processing of such PII by a third-party service provider unless we can demonstrate that we are not responsible for the event that gave rise to the damages. We may also be required to disclose such PII in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including to meet national security or law enforcement requirements.
Links To Other Applications
Links To Other Applications

Our Service may contain links to other sites or services that are not operated by us. If you click on a third party link, you will be directed to that third party's site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site and service you visit.
We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services.
Data Security
Data Security

We take the security of the information we receive through our Online Services, including your PII, seriously. To that end, we implement reasonable and appropriate administrative, technical, and physical security controls to safeguard your PII from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. For instance, we use secure socket layer technology (SSL) when providing our Online Services and require you to input a password to access your account information. It is essential that you keep your account password confidential and not disclose it to others. Although we make every effort to protect your PII, no security control is entirely risk-free, and we cannot guarantee that your PII will always be secure. You may refer to our Security Practices for up-to-date information on our security practices and policies.
Data Independence
Data Independence

To safeguard your privacy rights, we offer you options for controlling the collection, use, and sharing of your personally identifiable information (PII). If you receive newsletters or promotional emails from us, you can opt-out of receiving further communications by following the unsubscribe instructions in the email or contacting us directly. However, we reserve the right to send you notices of any updates to our Terms of Use or Privacy Policy, regardless of your email preferences.

You can also edit or delete your PII in your account on the Online Services, including your contact information and notification settings, by accessing your account profile. If you want us to delete your account information, you can email us at support@taskcallapp.com. However, please note that we may be required by law or other regulations to keep some information, in which case we will comply with your deletion request only after fulfilling such requirements. We will respond to your requests within thirty (30) days or sooner if required by law. When we delete your account information, it will be removed from the active database but may remain in our archives for a limited time. We will otherwise retain your information for as long as your account is active, as needed to provide you with the Online Services you have requested, or as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

If a customer has registered for our Services, and your PII has been collected as a result of their use of our Services, we will process your information under the direction of the relevant customer. If you want to access, edit, delete, or exercise any rights under applicable data protection laws regarding any PII we have collected about you, please contact the relevant customer directly. We will, however, provide reasonable assistance to our customers to give effect to data subject rights as appropriate and required by applicable laws.

Please note that when we provide links to third-party sites, we do not endorse the contents of those sites or their privacy policies. Clicking on such a link will take you away from our site, and any data, including PII, that a third party collects from you will be subject to their privacy policy, not ours. We encourage you to read the privacy statements of any third-party websites you visit.

TaskCall offers its services from two primary regions – United States and the European Union (EU). Each region’s data is stored in isolated environments and never leave the region except for some basic PII information in some cases. By accessing or using our Online Services, or providing information to us, you understand that your PII information may be processed, transferred, and stored in other locations. If we transfer your Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA) to a country that does not have an adequate level of data protection, we will ensure that the recipient of your Personal Data offers an adequate level of protection, as required by applicable law. This may include measures such as entering into standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission or gaining prior consent.
Children's Privacy
Children's Privacy

Our Online Services are designed for use by individuals who are at least thirteen (13) years old or older. TaskCall does not knowingly collect or solicit personal information from individuals under the age of thirteen (13). If you believe that TaskCall has unintentionally collected information about a child under the age of thirteen (13), please contact us immediately at privacy@taskcallapp.com using the contact information provided below.
Changes to Our Privacy Policy
Changes to Our Privacy Policy

TaskCall retains the right to modify this Privacy Policy. Any significant changes to this Privacy Statement will be communicated to you via our Website and, if necessary, by sending an email to the email address we have on file for you, at least thirty (30) days before the changes become effective.
Contact Us
Contact Us
Thanks for reading our Privacy Policy. TaskCall welcomes your comments, questions, and concerns regarding our Privacy Policy. Please contact us at privacy@taskcallapp.com.
